actor_awards.notes: Astin received an Academy Award nomination for Best Live Action Short Film for writing, directing, and starring in 'Prelude' (1968). He is most famous for his role as Gomez Addams in 'The Addams Family' television series.

filmography.title: West Side Story
filmography.role_description: A well-meaning but hopelessly square social worker who tries to organize a 'friendly' dance at the gym between the rival gangs, the Jets and the Sharks.
filmography.plot: Two youngsters from rival New York City gangs fall in love, but tensions between their respective friends build toward tragedy.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Picture (Film won 10 Oscars)

filmography.title: The Frighteners
filmography.role_description: A decaying, ancient ghost from the Old West who is one of Frank Bannister's spectral partners in his ghost-busting con games.
filmography.plot: A man who communicates with spirits uses them to con people until a demonic ghost begins killing both the living and the dead.
filmography.awards: Saturn Award: Nominated – Best Horror Film

filmography.title: Evil Roy Slade
filmography.role_description: The meanest villain in the West, who falls in love with a sweet schoolteacher and attempts to reform his wicked ways despite being hunted by a singing marshal.
filmography.plot: A legendary outlaw tries to go straight for the love of a woman, but finds civilized life harder than robbing trains.

filmography.title: Prelude
filmography.role_description: Astin wrote, directed, and starred in this short film about a man who navigates a series of surreal encounters while waiting for a repairman.
filmography.plot: A short film exploring the daydreams and realities of a man as he waits for a repairman to fix his appliances.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Short Subject, Live Action Subjects

filmography.title: That Touch of Mink
filmography.role_description: A sleazy, unpleasant unemployment clerk who harasses Doris Day's character when she comes looking for work.
filmography.plot: A rich businessman courts a young woman who insists on marriage before intimacy, leading to a comedic battle of wills.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Motion Picture – Comedy or Musical

filmography.title: Freaky Friday
filmography.role_description: The bewildered father and husband who is completely oblivious to the fact that his wife and daughter have switched bodies.
filmography.plot: A mother and daughter switch bodies for a day and gain a new appreciation for each other's lives.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nominated – Best Actress (Jodie Foster & Barbara Harris)

filmography.title: National Lampoon's European Vacation
filmography.role_description: The cheesy, over-enthusiastic host of the 'Pig in a Poke' game show who awards the Griswold family their disastrous European trip.
filmography.plot: The Griswold family wins a vacation tour across Europe where their usual bad luck follows them to London, Paris, and Rome.

filmography.title: Gremlins 2: The New Batch
filmography.role_description: A quirky janitor working in the Clamp Center skyscraper who encounters the gremlins as they begin their takeover.
filmography.plot: The Gremlins return to take over a high-tech media mogul's skyscraper in New York City.
filmography.awards: Saturn Award: Nominated – Best Fantasy Film

filmography.title: Move Over, Darling
filmography.role_description: An aggressive insurance agent involved in the legal complications surrounding a man whose wife returns five years after being declared dead.
filmography.plot: A woman who was lost at sea for five years returns home on the day her husband is remarrying.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nominated – Best Actress (Doris Day)

filmography.title: Return of the Killer Tomatoes!
filmography.role_description: A mad scientist who creates a process to transform tomatoes into human replicas, planning to use them to take over the world.
filmography.plot: Crazy old Professor Gangreen has developed a way to make tomatoes look human for a second invasion.

filmography.title: Get to Know Your Rabbit
filmography.role_description: The boss of the protagonist, representing the corporate rat race that the hero tries to escape by becoming a tap-dancing magician.
filmography.plot: A corporate executive drops out of the rat race to become a tap-dancing magician.

filmography.title: Candy
filmography.role_description: Astin plays a dual role as the protagonist's uptight father and his lecherous twin brother in this psychedelic sex farce.
filmography.plot: A naive high school girl seeks meaning in life and encounters a variety of eccentric characters who try to seduce her.

filmography.title: Viva Max!
filmography.role_description: The loyal, long-suffering sergeant to a Mexican general who marches a small squad into Texas to retake the Alamo.
filmography.plot: A Mexican general leads a platoon of soldiers into the United States to reoccupy the Alamo in modern times.

filmography.title: The Wheeler Dealers
filmography.role_description: A frantic securities and exchange commission official trying to keep up with the stock market manipulation of the main characters.
filmography.plot: A Texas oil millionaire goes to New York to play the stock market and falls for a female stock analyst.

filmography.title: Bunny O'Hare
filmography.role_description: A supporting role in this comedy about two senior citizens who rob banks dressed as hippies.
filmography.plot: An eclectic widow and a fugitive bank robber team up to rob banks while disguised as hippies.

filmography.title: Halloween with the New Addams Family
filmography.role_description: Astin reprises his signature role as the suave, eccentric patriarch of the Addams clan in this television movie reunion.
filmography.plot: The Addams Family is prepared for the best Halloween ever, but a gang of crooks tries to ruin the fun.

filmography.title: Night Life
filmography.role_description: A creepy, undead mortician who torments a teenager working the night shift at a funeral home.
filmography.plot: A high school outcast working at a mortuary must survive the night when the corpses he embalmed come back to life.

filmography.title: The Brothers O'Toole
filmography.role_description: A dual role playing a sophisticated con man and his evil outlaw doppelgänger in a western comedy.
filmography.plot: Two brothers turn a sleepy mining town upside down in their search for gold and encounter a notorious outlaw.

filmography.title: School of Life
filmography.role_description: An elderly, legendary teacher and grandfather figure who offers wisdom to the younger staff at Fallbrook Middle School.
filmography.plot: A new, cool teacher arrives at a school and wins over the students, making the current Teacher of the Year jealous.

filmography.title: Teen Wolf Too
filmography.role_description: The college dean who discovers the protagonist's werewolf secret and exploits his boxing talents for the university's gain.
filmography.plot: The cousin of the original Teen Wolf goes to college on a boxing scholarship and discovers he has the family curse.

filmography.title: Killer Tomatoes Strike Back!
filmography.role_description: Astin returns as the mad professor, this time posing as a talk show host to brainwash the public.
filmography.plot: Professor Gangreen and his tomato assistant Igor try to take over the world by brainwashing the population through a TV talk show.

filmography.title: The Silence of the Hams
filmography.role_description: A comedic role in this spoof film, playing a ranger who interacts with the bumbling detective protagonist.
filmography.plot: A spoof of 'The Silence of the Lambs' and 'Psycho', following an FBI agent hunting a serial killer.

filmography.title: Huck and the King of Hearts
filmography.role_description: A modern-day character encountered by Huck and Tom in this reimagining of the classic Mark Twain tale.
filmography.plot: A modern retelling of Huckleberry Finn, where Huck and a card shark travel across the country searching for Huck's grandfather.

filmography.title: Every Little Crook and Nanny
filmography.role_description: A mob lawyer involved in the kidnapping plot of a crime boss's son.
filmography.plot: A nanny kidnaps the son of her mobster employer to get back pay, leading to a comedy of errors involving the underworld.

filmography.title: Betaville
filmography.role_description: A corporate executive in a futuristic sci-fi setting, representing the establishment.
filmography.plot: A futuristic noir thriller set in a world where corporate interests control everything.
